course.subject: FINA
course.name: International Finance
course.description: An introduction to the fundamental principles of international financial management and investment.  Topics include: international financial markets and instruments; foreign exchange markets; foreign currency derivatives and currency risk; international capital budgeting; international bond and equity markets.

reviews.comment_content:
Quantitative course

Before midterm:
Topic 1: Introduction
Topic 2: The Foreign Exchange Market
Topic 3: International Parity Relationships, Exchange Rate Determination and Forecasting
    (Special topic: Currency Investment Strategies)
After midterm:
Topic 4: Balance of Payments
Special topic: Currency Investment Strategies
    (Case study: the Mexico Peso Crisis)
Topic 5: Currency Derivatives
Topic 6: Managing Foreign Exchange Risks
    (Case study: Hedging currency risks at AIFS)
Topic 7: International Investment

Personally I think the content is somehow similar to 3204, so not a must to reg this course...
reviews.comment_teaching:
He is a very passionate professor, well preparation.
He also provides lots of extra material, e.g. 8 optional exercises, in-class quiz for us to revise.
The homework provided is also practical for us in the future.
The powerpoint slides are very informative so you don't need to buy textbook at all.

But he sends email to us too frequently somehow i feel annoyed xdd.
reviews.comment_grading:
Assignment 16% (4份) (加埋236.5/255) (mean 229.3/255)
    - group assignment, 純計數同用excel, 一份都幾長下
Case Study and Presentation (15%)
    - presentation + report about an international market case
Mid term (25%) 87/100 (mean 82.1)
   - must revise all optional exercise, some questions are direct copying.
Final Exam (40%) 88/100 (mean 83.1)
Peer Evaluation (4%) -
Optional Exercise and In-class Participation (0%)
    - but professor says this may make you from b+ to a- if you are in margin.


Turnout B+, I think the grading is still okay since my group perform quite bad in the project.
reviews.comment_workload:
Workload is normal for a 4-credit course.
Practice makes perfect.
The final is cumulative (30% before midterm, 70% after midterm)

reviews.author: Zeta
reviews.title: 少value-added; 適合FINA同學呃Credit用
reviews.comment_content:
雖然見到"international finance"第一下會覺得好勁，但其實內容不過是將你學過既基礎fina知識套用於cross-border層面，再補充一d只會於國際層面先會出現既特色。

舉幾個例子就會明白:
1. 你學過stock market既risk and return關係，今次就係考慮埋買foreign security時面對既exchange rate risk
2. 你學過bond valuation，今次就係學新一種叫dual currency bond，即係final payment會用另一隻currency
3. 你學過capital budgeting，今次就係比較同一個project既PV，但用唔同currency既觀點去衡量應唔應該take

簡單來說，即係好多野你只要明白exchange rate既概念，加入去你故有既fina2303 & 3104知識，就會handle到呢個course 7-8成既內容。

如果你問我乜野係最有用，我會答係一開始教既Interest rate parity，同之後既fisher equation，呢兩條equation係成個course既主軸，一定要明同用到。

總結，如標題所講，如果你真心想學野，呢個course價值不大，最多令你睇得明平時電視既國際財經新聞up緊乜。
但如果FINA同學想求其fulfill major requirement既話，呢個會係唔錯既選擇，基於grading, credit, workload既考慮。
reviews.comment_teaching:
俾D rating係有充分既原因。
介紹下，Ekkachai本身已經以佢既英語口音係fina出左名，有d人覺得搞笑，有d人頂唔順，呢個我唔計入教學素質考慮啦。

真正重點係，成個course令人感覺佢冇花過心思去arrange佢既教學。PPT slides係最明顯，因為9成內容佢只係將書既文字/圖表直接cap低再paste上ppt，而且仲要極低清，睇得好唔舒服。另一後果係，佢直接揀d黎copy and paste，教學又何來有連續性同structure呢....?

其實你會睇得出，佢講書既時候，佢並唔係太知下一張slide係講乜，而似係見到乜就講乜。所以我唔太欣賞。

同學發問既時候佢好多時都唔太識答，或者答左但你依然唔知做緊咩。

Ekkachai最有心機既時候反而係佢講財經新聞既時間，佢會堂堂都花d時間講下d國際新聞，train up我地對headlines既即時理解同反應。就呢一點而言，我係欣賞佢intention的。

Tutorial是有的，但我一堂都冇上過。事關佢add-drop完左先announce時間地點。No comment here.
reviews.comment_grading:
Assignment x 3   15% (mean ~90%)
Midterm              32% (mean ~76%)
Final                   40% (mean ~78%)
Participation         3%  (mean ~83%)
Group Project     10% (mean ~79%)
Total                   100%(mean ~80%)

Sem頭會俾你自己分組，3人一組，assignment同project都以呢個單位黎做。
Asg有3份，每次十幾條，分左佢黎做就好輕鬆，但注意，每份佔5%。
Midterm同Final，性質我認為係qualitative三成、quantitative七成，但計數唔算高難度同complex，最複雜係capital budgeting/ interest rate swap。
Project係叫你自己搵個interesting而關事既題目，寫個report同準備一個10分鐘既ppt就可以。Presentation唔一定要，pre左都冇分加，所以呢part絕對輕鬆。但佢sem尾會invite幾組出黎pre。

我總分84% = B+，推斷整體grading應該唔差。
reviews.comment_workload:
4 Credit黎講，workload真係極少。功課做得果3次，project得10%又無present壓力所以難度同認真程度大減。主要考試前認認真真睇ppt + text book + 重做一次功課就可以了，course material本來就唔深，所以要catch-up冇咩難度。
唯一唔好處就係participation果3%係要答~20條PRS/ 開口回應prof 6次，想走堂既話最後快快手答晒d問題先。

reviews.author: KIHIN
reviews.title: Not Bad
reviews.comment_content:
Covered different financial instruments in FOREX market(spot future option swap). Also there would be some valuation method on how should a currency be priced. Mostly simple calculation and interpretation of numbers.

Having understanding in how prices are quoted and bid-ask prices will accelerate your learning in the earlier part.
reviews.comment_teaching: Professor Li is an enthusiastic professor and he welcome student ask question. Just sometimes he can explain more details. Every lecture there will be a small quiz for the whole class and the quizes would be helpful for you to recall about the last lesson.
reviews.comment_grading:
The mean was quite high and sd was low so it's quite hard to get a good grade. Better to get over 85% or above to get B or higher grade.

I did not perform well in midterm and I got an B+
reviews.comment_workload:
Assignments: 16%
Case study and presentation: 15%
Midterm exam: 25%
Final exam: 40%
Peer evaluation: 4%

-Final exam covered from the first lecture,
-Case will be assigned to each group on a specific topic about the FOREX
-There will be participation points for tight breaking points. Answering question and working on optional exercises every week will do.

reviews.author: garyisdumb
reviews.comment_content: Content is interesting and quite practical, professor makes references to many cases which are highly relevant to course material.
reviews.comment_teaching: Professor's english is good, and is very energetic in his teaching. Goes through material thoroughly and clearly, and is very friendly and eager to answer any questions.
reviews.comment_grading: coursework includes homework sets which are done per group, and are generally quite easy, though if you want good grades you should go through the questions yourself. Professor also goes through difficult problems from the sets in class, and some are very similar to exam questions. Going to class and answering questions also gives extra credit, and raising questions during end of term presentations count for even more.
reviews.comment_workload: There is a group project which counts for a lot, and and one midterm and one final exam. Homework sets also count for a decent portion.
